acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48-hour EC50=3250microg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (AQUIRE, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Rat LD50 = 285mg/kg , and rabbit LD50 = 50mg/kg (both are RTECS (2003)). The lower value of rabbit LD50 value was adopted, and it was set as Category 1.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
Among rat LD50 = 50mg/kg (RTECS(2003)) and 83mg/kg (HSDB(2003)), the lower value (50mg/kg) was adopted to classify as category 2.

[Note] In addition, also refer to nicotine (ID 608, CAS:54-11-5) about healthy hazards.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 2, since acute toxicity was Category 2, and supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), though supposed less bio-accumulative (log Kow=0.4(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Not classified because of UNRTDG No. 1685, Class: 6.1, PG II (not Class: 4.1) though "Flammable" (Sax, 11th, 2004)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not classified because of UNRTDG No. 1658, Class: 6.1, II (not Class: 4.2)

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: This product was also considered as Category 2 as well as nicotine, since head facial anomaly are seen by the intraperitoneal injection into pregnant mice of this product (RTECS (2003)), there is description "it is shown in the animal experiments that it may have toxic effects on human reproduction" (ICSC (J) (1997), SITTIG (4th, 2002), HSFS (2002)), the affect on reproduction by nicotine (ID 608, CAS: 54-11-5) was suggested. Refer to the reproductive toxicity of nicotine (ID 608, CAS: 54-11-5).

self_heating_substances.rationale: UNRTDG is classified into 6.1 and II according to the U.N. number (1658) peculiar to this substance. Since 4.2 which indicates a self-febrility chemistry article was not attached, it carried out the outside of Category.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In Priority 2, since there is the  description which indicates irritation to the human eye (ICSC (J), (1997), SITTIG (4th, 2002), HSFS (2002)), it was classified into Category 2A-2B. In addition, it is difficult to subdivide the Category of this data.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In Priority 2, since there was description which indicates irritation to human skin (ICSC (J), (1997), SITTIG (4th, 2002), HSFS (2002)), it was set as Category 2.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: The result of the patch test using this material to the vegetable producer who produced the dermatitis by agricultural chemicals in Priority 2, there is a report that 10-28% of people showed susceptibility (HSDB(2003)), it is only one example, and data of a report is insufficient and it cannot classify.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 2 (central nervous system),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause damage to organs (central nervous system)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 2 (central nervous system) and Category 3 (airway irritant). Because it is reported in Priority 2 that it affects the central nervous system in humans (ICSC (J) (1997),  SITTIG (4th, 2002)), and that inhalation of it causes irritation to nose and throat (SITTIG (4th, 2002)). It is also reported that nicotine has irritant properties to the peripheral autonomic nervous system and the nerve terminals of skeletal muscle (Refer to nicotine (ID608, CAS: 54-11-5).
